summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan in the United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell case, dated November 23, 2021. It attaches and discusses draft preliminary jury instructions for the trial, including specific rules regarding witness anonymity, juror conduct, and the trial process during the COVID-19 pandemic.

events.title: Court Issues Draft Jury Instructions
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan issues an order attaching draft preliminary instructions for the sworn jury in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial, following a conference held that day.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The court issued draft preliminary jury instructions for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial, allowing parties to suggest edits by November 27, 2021.

The instructions include a specific rule that certain witnesses may testify or be referred to by first name or pseudonym only to protect their privacy, with their full names known to the government, defendant, and court.

The instructions contain extensive rules for juror conduct, including prohibitions on discussing the case, researching it independently, or using electronic devices/social media to communicate about it.
The trial was conducted with COVID-19 precautions, including witnesses and lawyers testifying from a Plexiglass box with a HEPA filter where they could remove masks.
